name: Sous Vide Salmon
author: Bren
summary: Wonderfully moist and flavorful. We like our salmon on the firmer side, but this can easily be adjusted. Just lower the cooking temperature if you prefer it yours medium.
directions: Fill a large pot with warm water
Attach a sous vide precision cooker to the pot and set temperature to 125 degrees F (51°C)
Place shallot into a plastic bag and lay the salmon on top, skin-side down
Use a vacuum sealer to remove the air and seal the bag or use the water-immersion method
Once water temperature has reached 125 degrees F (51°C), add the bag to the pot and set timer for 45 minutes
Remove bag from the pot when the timer goes off and pat dry
Heat olive oil in a nonstick or cast-iron skillet over medium heat until it shimmers
Add salmon, skin-side down, and sear for 1 1/2 minutes
Flip and sear for an additional 1 1/2 minutes
